name: Accesslevel

properties1.name: name
properties1.description: (mandatory) is the unique name of the field. This must match the name of the query results column that contains the values that will be shown to the user in the drop-down list, unless a different name is specified in the value_field attribute.

properties2.name: label
properties2.description: (mandatory) (translatable) is the descriptive title of the field.

properties3.name: description
properties3.example: Select an access level to this concept.
properties3.description: (optional) (translatable) is text that will be shown as a tooltip when the user moves the mouse over the drop-down box.

properties4.name: class
properties4.description: (optional) is a CSS class name for the HTML form field.

properties5.name: required
properties5.description: (optional) is the field required true if yes.

properties6.name: multiple
properties6.description: (optional) If set to multiple then allows more than one usergroup to be selected.

properties7.name: showon
properties7.description: (optional) show this field on the bases of the value in another field. https://joomla.stackexchange.com/a/17682/2166

description: Remember all views already have [accesslevel] added by default, only add this if you need more custom access selection! Provides a dropdown list of accesslevel options with the current option selected.
